channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: PM braced for SECOND police fine - this time over a 'BYOB' event in the Downing Street garden
item.description: The Prime Minister, who has already paid a £50 FPN over a 56th birthday bash in Number 10 in June 2020, could also now have to stump up over the 'BYOB' event a month earlier.

item.title: England Nations League matches to be aired on Channel 4 as broadcaster wins rights for tournament
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Channel 4 has won the battle to broadcast England's Nations League matches this summer.
item.media:credit: Xinhua/REX / Getty Images / POOL/AFP via Getty Images

item.title: Youngest son of Canoe man John Darwin now teaches SWORD FIGHTING
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Anthony Darwin, 43, who has now changed his surname to his mother's maiden name, is now an instructor in 'Historical European Martial Arts', MailOnline has learned

item.title: Queen visits horses at Sandringham the day after her birthday
item.description: Wearing one of her signature headscarves, Her Majesty, 96, was seen in the front passenger seat of a Range Rover leaving Wood Farm near Sandringham in Norfolk.

item.title: Prince Harry reveals the next Invictus Games will held in Canada
item.description: The Duke of Sussex said the Invictus Games 2025 will take place in Vancouver and nearby Whistler - which are about a three-hour flight away from his family's £11million mansion in California.
item.media:credit: Twitter/Marina v Stackelberg/CBC News / Getty Images for the Invictus Ga

item.title: Ukraine-Russian war: Boris Johnson says UK could ship armoured vehicles to Poland
item.description: Speaking during a news conference in New Delhi, the Prime Minister today said the Government was contemplating sending tanks to Poland.

item.title: 'If he walked on water, they'd say he couldn't swim': Boris Johnson ally likens PM to JESUS
item.description: Northern Ireland minister Conor Burns insisted there were a number of Tory MPs who had 'never really supported' Mr Johnson as Conservative leader or PM.

item.title: Emma Raducanu crashes out of Stuttgart Open following straight-sets defeat by world No 1 Iga Swiatek
item.description: In only her fifth senior match on clay, Raducanu took her to 6-4 6-4 in an encounter that was closer than predicted, despite teenager needing treatment during the second set.

item.title: Neighbour is 'forced to rebuild garden wall' due to out of control vines on next door's home in Kent
item.description: A severely overgrown garden has engulfed a house in Ramsgate, east Kent, causing locals to complain about the vine-ridden property - as one neighbour says they had to rebuild their wall.

item.title: Johnny Depp called ex Vanessa Paradis an 'extortionist French c***' in email to Elton John
item.description: Johnny Depp shares two children with French actress and singer Vanessa Paradis. They were together for about 14 years from 1998 to 2012.

item.title: King Willem-Alexander shakes hands with Prince Harry
item.description: Prince Harry, 37, who is flying solo after his wife Meghan returned to California, sat next to the Dutch monarch to watch the final of the wheelchair basketball competition in The Hague.
item.media:credit: Getty Images for the Invictus Ga / Bruce Adams/Daily Mail

item.title: Prince Harry says he wants to teach Archie and Lilibet about finding 'purpose'
item.description: Speaking to People magazine, the Duke of Sussex said that he's 'grateful' for his military experience, and will tell his children that 'finding your purpose is one of the most gratifying experiences'.

item.title: Naughty toddlers unleash paint tsunami in kitchen
item.description: Hayley Kidd, 27, from Knaresborough, North Yorkshire, popped upstairs to use the toilet and put away some washing for less than five minutes, thinking her children were in the garden.

item.title: Is this Elon Musk's only luxury? Inside the Tesla CEO's $66.5 million Gulfstream G650ER
item.description: Despite claiming he couch surfs and currently doesn't have a home, Elon Musk admitted he does indulge in a Gulfstream G650ER- his luxurious $70 million private jet.

item.title: Three people found dead at sheltered accommodation died from stab wounds, post mortem reveals
item.description: Police have said that Susan and Jeffrey Farrance, in their 60s, and a man in his 50s, all died of stab wounds at Orchard House in Bourne End, Buckinghamshire on Tuesday.

item.title: Harry Potter fans plead with National Trust to let Dobby's grave stay on Pembrokeshire beach
item.description: The fictional house-elf was buried at the location in the 2010 film Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1 after he was killed by Bellatrix Lestrange.

item.title: Coldstream Guard accused of plotting to sell ammunition is to stand trial this summer
item.description: Kirtland Gill, pictured, of Windsor, Berkshire, is accused of being involved in a conspiracy to sell or transfer ammunition and possession of a prohibited weapon.

item.title: 'Matchmaker' from Wiltshire reveals she has found homes for more than ONE HUNDRED Ukrainian refugees
item.description: Narelle Guthrie, 35, from Wiltshire travelled to the Polish-Ukraine border using her savings to matchmake Ukrainian refugees with British families willing to home them.

item.title: Yorkshire locals fuming as they face being outnumbered by 1,500 young male asylum seekers
item.description: House prices in the tiny community of Linton-on-Ouse, near York, have already crashed with some homeowners being pushed into negative equity and unable to move out.

item.title: Florida man punched by Mike Tyson on JetBlue plane is identified as a 36-year-old criminal
item.description: The man who was punched by Mike Tyson after allegedly harassing the boxer on a JetBlue airplane at the San Francisco Airport has been identified - and he has a lengthy criminal record.

item.title: Putin is seen gripping a table amid cancer battle rumours as he meets 'slurring' defence minister
item.description: Vladimir Putin's poor posture and his bloated face and neck sparked speculation about the Russian leader's health, which has reportedly been in decline since the Ukraine invasion.

item.title: Mystery over FOUR 'suspicious suicides' of Russian gas executives 'linked to Putin'
item.description: Two wealthy businessmen were found dead along with their family members this week, but now suspicions are being raised about two deaths earlier this year for Kremlin-linked figures.

item.title: Russia outlines plans to seize Ukraine's entire south coast to create a land corridor to MOLDOVA
item.description: The deputy commander of Russia's central military district, Rustam Minnekayev, said Russia planned to forge a corridor between Crimea and the Donbas in eastern Ukraine.

item.title: Nadine Dorries says it's IMPOSSIBLE for trans identified males to compete fairly against women
item.description: The Culture Secretary (pictured) has called on sporting bodies to 'protect female athletes' and backed the idea of 'having trans categories' in order to maintain compassion for trans athletes.

item.title: Disney stocks tumble 31% as it's set to be stripped of its special privileges in Florida
item.description: As Disney is set to lose its special privileges in Florida the company's stocks continue to take a tumble, closing at $126.66 per share on Thursday, a 31 percent drop over the course of the last year.
item.media:credit: Reedy Creek Fire Department / Getty Images for Disney Dreamers

item.title: Patsy Palmer leaves fans outraged as she charges £17.99 for 'exclusive' Instagram content
item.description: The actress, 49, has been slammed by her fans hit by the cost of living crisis after she asked them to pay £17.99 a month on Instagram for 'exclusive' content.

item.title: At least 33 killed as blast rips through mosque during Friday prayers in latest Afghanistan attack
item.description: At least 33 people were killed during Friday prayers after a bomb exploded at a mosque in Afghanistan. The Mawlawi Sekandar Mosque is the town's second bombsite in two days

item.title: BGT's Francine Lewis vows to never forgive husband after accusing him of cheating live on TV
item.description: Britain's Got Talent comedian Francine Lewis has vowed to never forgive her husband after she accused him of having an affair live on Friday's GB News.

item.title: Devotees of 'testicle tanning' treatment promoted by Tucker Carlson speak about benefits of therapy
item.description: Tucker, 52, was roasted when he suggested men undergo 'testicle tanning' to increase testosterone. But according to five guys who tried it, the process has indeed boosted their 'sexual desire.'
item.media:credit: Fox News / Instagram / Courtesy Ben Greenfield

item.title: Piers Morgan shares clip of Nigel Farage calling his 'friend' Donald Trump 'angry' and 'one-geared'
item.description: In the 'leaked' clip at an unknown event, the former UKIP and Brexit Party leader can be heard saying: 'I think there are real problems with Trump.'

item.title: World Snooker Championship: Pigeon interrupts second round fixtures by landing on table at Crucible
item.description: A pigeon incredibly brought the World Snooker Championship to a halt on Friday by finding its way into Sheffield's Crucible Theatre and perching itself on a table.

item.title: Anatomy of a Scandal interiors send fans of the Netflix show about Westminster wives wild
item.description: Fans have praised the stunning interiors on Netflix's Anatomy of a Scandal with one writing: 'natomy of Scandal is good but that kitchen?! I've never wanted something so bad in my life'.

item.title: Laura Kenny, 29, reveals she suffered a miscarriage last year
item.description: The Olympic gold medallist, 29, who shares son Albie, four, with her Olympian husband Jason, 34, also revealed that she had one of her fallopian due to an ectopic pregnancy.

item.title: Nail technician uses purple SHAMPOO designed for blonde hair to keep her veneers white
item.description: Saskia Ward, 24, from Manchester, lathers purple shampoo onto her teeth most nights before bed to make them glisten when she wakes up.

item.title: Madeleine McCann's parents 'welcome' news German rapist Christian Brueckner has 'arguido' status
item.description: Brueckner, 44, who has been linked to four other child murders across Europe since 1996, was sensationally named by German prosecutors as the man 'responsible' for Madeleine's kidnap.

item.title: Eccentric millionaire Glenn Tamplin told to remove 15,000-ton waste MOUNTAIN from £10m Essex mansion
item.description: The steel tycoon, who is friends with Mark Wright and Jake Hall from TOWIE, has been ordered by Essex County Council to clean up the mountain of waste at his £10 million mansion.

item.title: PM's father Stanley Johnson hosts Beijing's ambassador for lunch at his London home
item.description: Stanley Johnson this week revealed on his Instagram account he had hosted China's ambassador to the UK, Zheng Zeguang, and the diplomat's wife, Hua Mei, for lunch at his London home.

item.title: Calls for a radical overhaul of ENTIRE care system as yet ANOTHER child is failed by social services
item.description: The Children's Commissioner for England said the 'same platitudes must not be tolerated' as it emerged a boy, seven, died two days after social services voted to take him off his mother.

item.title: Femail reveals where the cast of E.T. are now
item.description: Here, FEMAIL reveals the unlikely careers of the stars, as they reunite for the 40th anniversary special...
item.media:credit: Universal/Kobal/Shutterstock / Bruce Mcbroom/Universal/Kobal/Shutterstock / Getty Images for TCM / Dave Benett/WireImage / The Washington Post via Getty Im

item.title: Insulate Britain protesters delayed ambulance for almost an hour, court hears
item.description: Sue Spencer-Longhurst, pictured right, pleaded guilty today to two counts of causing a public nuisance on the M25 with Michelle Charlesworth, second right, and Meredith Williams, left.

item.title: E.T star Matthew De Merritt,reunites with film's cast and Steven Spielberg 40 years on
item.description: The real star of 1982 blockbuster movie E.T. The Extra-Terrestrial reunited with his co-stars and director Steven Spielberg on Thursday,

item.title: White supremacists claim ownership over Hollywood blockbuster The Northman
item.description: The new blockbuster The Northman has been praised by 4chan users for 'restoring pride in our people', saying the Viking film would be 'epic.'

item.title: Health chiefs stick to 'reckless' decision to only offer free influenza vaccines to 65+
item.description: Despite backlash, the Department of Health today confirmed the newly eligible groups will no longer receive the jab for free through the NHS in England.

item.title: Social workers voted to take boy, seven, off his mother but decided to 'leave it until Monday'
item.description: The alert - at a child protection conference on Friday afternoon - was not immediately acted on and, by Sunday November 26, 2017, Hakeem Hussain, aged seven, had died from an asthma attack.

item.title: Online shopping dropped 7.9% in March while fuel sales fell 3.8% amid soaring petrol and diesel cost
item.description: Retail sales dropped by 1.4 per cent in March, led by online sales plunging by 7.9 per cent last month - following a 6.9 per cent fall in February, according to the Office for National Statistics (ONS).

item.title: Elon Musk's SpaceX Starlink 'rapidly' fought off a Russian jamming attack in Ukraine
item.description: An official from the US Office of the Secretary of Defense said the US military would have taken much longer to counter the attack against the SpaceX network.

item.title: Craving junk on a diet? Go a run: Study finds strenuous exercise makes you less likely to cave
item.description: A study by Washington State University has found rats subjected to an intense exercise regime were better able to resist cravings for fatty food and it could have implications for human dieters.

item.title: UK records fewer than 20k daily cases for second day in a row and 284 deaths
item.description: UK Health Security Agency (UKHSA) bosses posted another 19,795 cases to the Covid dashboard over the last 24 hours.

item.title: Mother who murdered Logan featured in a homemade slasher movie finding the body of a dead child
item.description: Video shows Angharad Williamson as a teenager finding a dead family member on a sofa and then screaming in terror at her shock discovery for an amateur flick for an A-level project.

item.title: Mother blasts Toby Carvery after her son's foot-long hotdog was served up in tiny bun
item.description: Irayna Coleman-Green, 47, took to Facebook to share the 'disappointing lunch' she had with family in Aldenham, Hertfordshire on Monday.

item.title: Foster parents of boy, 14, who murdered Logan Mwangi 'lived in fear' and warned social services
item.description: The elderly couple, who have taken 80 children into their semi-detached home in South Wales, said the teenager who killed Logan Mwangi was 'far and away' the worst.

item.title: English Heritage bids to stage world's largest gathering of VAMPIRES
item.description: English Heritage wants to stage the gathering to mark the 125th anniversary of the publication of Bram Stoker's Dracula on May 26. Pictured: Vampire fans at Whitby Abbey.

item.title: Two fraudsters who conned 245 people out of £13.7MILLION are jailed for 10 years
item.description: Susan Dalton, 66, and Alan Barratt, 62, helped con 245 victims out of a total of £13.7 million. They were jailed at Southwark Crown Court today.

item.title: Amber Heard accused of COPYING Johnny Depp's courtroom outfits: see similarities between ensembles
item.description: Some people are convinced that Heard, 35, is purposely picking outfits that look similar to ones that Depp, 58, has previously worn during the trial, in an attempt to 'play mind games' on him.
item.media:credit: AP / Getty Images / Chris Bott for Dailymail.com

item.title: At least 70% of people have had Covid in England, official data shows
item.description: The Office for National Statistics estimates that 38.5million people got infected at some point in England between April 2020 and February 2022, the equivalent of 70.7 per cent.

item.title: Broom-wielding Chinese grandmother, 95, busts out of Shanghai quarantine THREE TIMES
item.description: China's 'zero-COVID' strategy has shut most businesses in the city while millions of residents have been locked down in their homes in an attempt to contain the spread.

item.title: Supermarkets warned of TOMATO SHORTAGE caused by soaring energy costs and supply chain issues
item.description: Tomato prices have risen by nearly 60 per cent over the past year, while there are also fewer options on supermarket shelves in what industry bosses have called a 'cocktail' of problems.

item.title: Ice creams made by Oreo and Biscoff can have as much salt as McDonald's fries
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: This website analysed the nutritional content of ice creams, as the UK is set to have another warm weekend - with temperatures expected to hit 18°C.

item.title: Europe experienced its warmest summer on record in 2021 due to climate change
item.description: Temperatures during the summer were 1.8°F (1°C) higher than the average for the previous three decades, according to the European Union's Copernicus Climate Change Service.

item.title: Jailbreak! Moment clever golden retriever unlocks cage to let his friends out to play [Video]
item.description: Footage shows Daisy the retriever longingly staring at her friends from outside their cage in Bangkok, Thailand, before she bites on the gate's handle and slides it across to open the door.

item.title: Anthrax, animal attacks, and sexual disorders, why some Brits needed medical help in lockdown
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: MailOnline has analysed the latest latest data on NHS patient admissions, appointments and attendances in England from April 1, 2020, to March 31, 2021.

item.title: Parents of 'miracle' conjoined twins - say pair 'constantly hug each other'
item.description: Proud parents Hannah and Dan Bateson from Norhern Ireland, has described their newborn twins conjoined twins Annabelle and Isabelle as 'miracles' who constantly hug each other.

item.title: YouTube is profiting from bogus STI cure videos
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: One video - advocated chewing garlic cloves three times a day to treat the infections, claiming the veg 'will clean you from the tip of your mouth to the anus'.

item.title: Builders use their digger to rescue dog from drowning in an irrigation channel in Ecuador [Video]
item.description: Builders working by an irrigation channel in Pasaje Canton were warned by people further down that there was a dog being carried along the current of fast-moving water and it was drowning.

item.title: Boys' hilarious conversation after woman agrees to pay them $20 to shovel snow in Winnipeg [Video]
item.description: Doorbell camera footage shows the two young boys walking up to a house in Winnipeg, Canada, on April 15 and knocking on the door in the hopes of drumming up some business.

item.title: Exasperated cat owner films 'trapped' moggy trying to jump over stair gate [Video]
item.description: Kayla Delcoure, 29, was watching TV at home in Atlanta, Georgia, on April 20 when she heard yowling coming from her Maine coon cat Gizmo upstairs.

item.title: Putin's 'lover' reappears with a 'new look' in Moscow amid rumours she was hiding in Swiss chalet
item.description: Olympic gold-medallist Alina Kabaeva, 38, resurfaced at a junior rhythmic gymnastics rehearsal in Moscow's VTB Arena this week ahead of a charity event.

item.title: Rikki Neave's sister blames their abusive mother for his death
item.description: Rikki Neave's sister Rochelle says she still holds their mother - who beat and neglected the six-year-old - accountable for his death despite James Watson's conviction.

item.title: Russian forces are STILL bombing Mariupol steelworks where Ukrainian fighters are hiding
item.description: Russian forces are still dropping 'several bombs' on Azovstal steelworks in Mariupol where Ukrainian troops are holed up, Petro Andryushchenko, an adviser to the city's mayor, said on Friday.

item.title: Ukraine war: Putin PROMOTES 'Butcher of Bucha' accused of overseeing massacre and mass rapes
item.description: The Russian officer, who led the 64th Separate Motorised Rifle Brigade, was identified as Putin's senior commander in Bucha when the barbarism unfolded.

item.title: Biden criticizes 'ugly' Republicans for targeting Disney after its criticism of Parental Rights Bill
item.description: President Joe Biden criticized 'ugly' Republicans for targeting Disney at his two west coast fundraisers Thursday.

item.title: Magnet fisherman and his father catch safe stashed with THOUSANDS dollars and return it to owner
item.description: George Tindale, 15, had been scouring the River Witham in Grantham, Lincolnshire, with his father Kevin, 52, when he made the discovery three weeks ago.

item.title: Mother reveals what the nine different baby cries mean
item.description: Anna Shields, from California, took to TikTok to explain that the cries are all indicators of different moods and needs, from a jerky 'eh' that means baby needs burping to a hungry 'neh'.

item.title: Queen Letizia of Spain goes understated in recycled sapphire Carolina Herrera
item.description: Queen Letizia recycled a blue Carolina Herrera gown as she stepped out with husband King Felipe II at the annual Miguel de Cervantes literary prize in Madrid.

item.title: Medieval women used bread kneaded on their bodies as an aphrodisiac, historian reveals
item.description: Speaking on new History Hit podcast Betwixt the Sheets, Dr Eleanor Janega revealed some of the bizarre aphrodisiacs that were popular during the medieval period.

item.title: White bride enters wedding reception walking black groom on a LEASH
item.description: Tra Alexander and his wife, from Gallatin, Tennessee, entered their reception to the sound of George Clinton's Atomic Dog, and the groom dropped to the floor and pretended to be a dog.

item.title: White bride enters wedding reception walking black groom on a LEASH
item.description: Tra Alexander and his wife, from Gallatin, Tennessee, entered their reception to the sound of George Clinton's Atomic Dog, and the groom dropped to the floor and pretended to be a dog.

item.title: Retired colonel, 51, in charge of Covid-19 task force must wait a year before facing trial
item.description: Marcus Reedman, 51, is charged with falsely claiming more than £43,000 in allowances to pay school fees.

item.title: Inside the festival that turns British countryside into the Wild West
item.description: MailOnline's Laycie Beck put on her line-dancing shoes for The British Westerners Association's 'Spring Round-Up' festival, featuring 'fast draw' contests and lassoing.

item.title: Chicago boss sends furious email to three employees who quit
item.description: An unnamed sales rep from Chicago took to Reddit to share the furious email her boss sent, branding three employees who quit at the same time for 'better opportunities' selfish and 'outrageous'.

item.title: Amir Khan's wife Faryal Makhdoom defends running away after mugging
item.description: Boxer Amid Khan, 35, and his wife Faryal Makhdoom, 30, were crossing the road in Leyton, East London, on Monday when two thugs ran over and pointed a gun in his face while demanding the watch.

item.title: Council to tear down 250-year-old 'racist relic' depicting a black child with a club and leaf skirt
item.description: The sculpture (pictured) is located on the side of a Grade II listed building named Blackboy House in Stroud, Gloucestershire, and strikes a bell on the hour.

item.title: Viking ship discovered 30ft underground in Norway using RADAR
item.description: The discovery was made as part of archeological work on a site that could form part of the route for the proposed E39 highway, near Øyesletta, western Norway.
item.media:credit: Credit: Jani Causevic/NIKU via Pen News

item.title: Tinder Swindler could face PRISON after he was 'caught using a fake driving licence in Spain'
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Simon Leviev, 31, is being probed over the use of a fake driving license after he got his £80,000 Maserati stuck on a Spanish beach during a day out with a mystery Russian blonde.

item.title: Jack Lisowski fumes after being BANNED from wearing a Ukraine flag at the Snooker World Championship
item.description: Lisowski, 30, who is part-Ukrainian, has sported the flag at previous tournaments and wanted to continue in a show of support for the country amid the Russian invasion there.

item.title: American teacher is sentenced to death in China for fatally stabbing his 21-year-old girlfriend
item.description: Shadeed Abdulmateen, of Los Angeles and a teacher at Ningbo University of Technology, met the victim, identified only by her surname, Chen, in 2019 after lying about being divorced.
item.media:credit: Ningbo University of Technology / Ningbo Intermediate People's Court

item.title: Kate Middleton is spotted picking up ice creams for Prince George and Princess Charlotte
item.description: Kate Middleton, 40, who also shares son Prince Louis, three, with the Duke, 39, was snapped visiting a vendor in a local London park to pick up Mr Whippy cones.
item.media:credit: BBC Children in Need/Comic Relie / PA

item.title: Bike was thrown onto railway tracks in south east London and caused electrical explosion [VIDEO]
item.description: Video which went viral online shows three men arguing on a platform in Sidcup station, in south east London, before one of them grabs a bike and lifts it in the air.

item.title: Invictus Games Prince Harry sports Archewell branded baseball cap at pub without Meghan Markle
item.description: The Duke of Sussex wore a black hat with the white letters 'A' and 'W' to help publicise the charitable organisation he runs with wife Meghan Markle when he visited a bar in The Hague for a pint last night.

item.title: Nick Ferrari on the smacking ban
item.description: Speaking during a discussion on This Morning, Sidcup-born presenter Nick Ferrari said he doesn't think the government has 'the right to tell me how to raise my child'.

item.title: Prince Harry hits the pub... on the Queen's birthday
item.description: With Meghan back home in California, Harry took the opportunity to pop into an Irish bar for a pint of Guinness in The Hague last night surrounded by five bodyguards.

item.title: Murdered MP Sir David Amess left an estate of more than £600,000 but had NO will
item.description: Sir David Amess, 69, was attacked by Ali Harbi Ali, 26, at a constituency surgery in Leigh-on-Sea on October 15 last year. He left an estate worth more than £616,000.

item.title: PM repeats vow to 'fix' Northern Ireland Protocol as ministers gear up for a fresh clash with EU
item.description: The PM said the agreement was not supported by a 'large, large component' of Northern Ireland's population and did not rule out 'taking further steps' to solve the issue.

item.title: Woman takes a BITE out of a watermelon on display outside London greengrocers [Video]
item.description: CCTV footage shows the brazen woman walking towards the supermarket in east London on Monday before going up to the watermelon and ripping off its protective clingfilm.

item.title: Pope Francis scraps his planned meeting with Russia's Patriarch Kirill
item.description: Pope Francis has said he has dropped plans to meet in June with Russian Orthodox Patriarch Kirill (left), an ally of Russian President Vladimir Putin who has backed Moscow's war in Ukraine.

item.title: Council ridiculed for spending £90,000 on rebranding Bromyard with a backwards 'D'
item.description: Town hall bosses recently applied for the government grant in a bid to attract more tourists to the small Herefordshire market town of Bromyard.

item.title: Most drivers lose their rag after 3 secs if others don't move off when lights go green
item.description: A new study has examined how quickly Britons are likely to lose their rag when 'slow coaches' don't move off when traffic lights go from red to green.

item.title: Scientists reveal the most off-putting flirting tactics - including swearing and being too touchy
item.description: Scientists from the University of Nicosia have revealed the 11 most off-putting flirting tactics, which are dealbreakers for many people.

item.title: Bling Ring leader Nick Prugo says he 'LEARNT' from the crimes in Channel 4 documentary
item.description: Speaking in the new documentary Bling Ring: Hollywood Heist, which airs on Channel 4 on Monday at 10pm, Nick Prugo said he felt 'a thrill' about the crimes.
item.media:credit: PUBLICITY PICTURE / Jordan Strauss/Invision/AP / AFP via Getty Images

item.title: Putin's ranting TV propagandist warns of war 'against Europe and the world' after Ukraine invasion
item.description: Vladimir Solovyov, known as 'Putin's voice', threatened Europe and all NATO countries with war as he said Russia's war is entering 'a new stage', adding that 'Ukrainians are no longer enough'.

item.title: BMW's new 7 Series limo debuts bold new looks and cinema screen
item.description: BMW's electrifying new 7 Series luxury limo has been launched on an epic scale with its own giant cinema screen - and a tantalising choice of main features.

item.title: Large Hadron Collider fires up for the first time in three years
item.description: Firing up the nearly 17 mile-long LHC under Switzerland is a complex process, requiring everything to 'work like an orchestra', especially after the extended shut down due to Covid-19.

item.title: Mike Tindall looks relaxed as he steps out in Soho alongside childhood friend Katherine Kelly
item.description: The former England Rugby Pro, 43, who is married to the Queen's eldest granddaughter Zara Tindall, wore a grey polo shirt as he walked through London.

item.title: Death row's oldest inmate has execution halted after 'oversight in preparing lethal injection'
item.description: Oscar Smith, 72, (pictured) was supposed to be killed by lethal injection in Tennessee's first execution since the pandemic began.

item.title: Feminist PhD student loses negligence case against 'woke' Bristol University
item.description: A PhD student has lost her attempt to sue Bristol University after claiming they colluded with trans activists who wanted to 'cancel her' when she said only biological women can give birth.

item.title: BNP Paribas trader who was fired when banker accused him of 'emotional terrorism' sues for £3m
item.description: Omar Alami was fired in 2019 from BNP Paribas after he publicly chastised an employee, calling them 'useless' and 'incompetent' for an apparent £666,000 loss - which turned out to be a false alarm.

item.title: Video caught moment killer driver, 24, murdered 'gang rival' teen by ramming him off quad bike
item.description: WARNING: DISTRESSING CONTENT. Rahees Mahmood died at the scene when Jordan Glover drove into the rear of his vehicle in Bradford, West Yorkshire.

item.title: Should heading be banned from women's football? Study claims they have weaker necks than men
item.description: Researchers from the University of Otago in Dunedin, New Zealand, conducted a review of 25 major studies looking into why women suffer more concussion than men in football.

item.title: Prince Edward and Sophie Wessex's Caribbean tour hits new problem after it axes Grenada visit
item.description: Prince Edward and Sophie's Royal tour - which has already postponed a visit to Grenada - has been warned: 'We hear the phony sanctimony of those who came before you'.

item.title: Duchess' best friend and makeup artist Daniel Martin hints Meghan Markle has plans for May
item.description: Meghan Markle's close friend Daniel Martin, from Seattle, commented on her hairdresser George Northwood's Instagram, writing: 'So happy I'll see you next month my friend.'

item.title: Covid UK: NHS in England will be banned from buying supplies linked to slavery
item.description: Under a new law as an amendment to the Health and Social Care Bill, the NHS will be prevented from buying equipment from parts of China where it is claimed slavery is used in supply chains.

item.title: Plymouth University tells women not to challenge people they think might be men using their toilets
item.description: Female students at the University of Plymouth have been told not to confront anyone they think is posing as a woman to use their toilets - and instead 'protect them from harm'.

item.title: Japanese newsreader breaks down in tears when reporting Putin has honoured troops for Bucha massacre
item.description: The unnamed Japanese news anchor was reporting that Vladimir Putin had honoured the soldiers for being 'a role model for special military operations' when she stopped to wipe away a tear.

item.title: A 70ft 'Tree of Trees' sculpture is to be unveiled outside Buckingham Palace for Platinum Jubilee
item.description: The 'Tree of Trees', a 70ft aluminium sculpture supporting 350 potted British native trees, is to be erected for the Queen's Platinum Jubilee outside Buckingham Palace.

item.title: Germany's Scholz suggests delivering tanks to Ukraine could spark nuclear war amid mounting fury
item.description: The leader has faced sharp criticism for failing to delivery heavy weapons to the besieged country, such as tanks and howitzers to fend off savage Russian attacks.

item.title: 15 Amazon deals to shop this weekend - including HUGE discounts on Apple AirTags
item.description: If you missed Amazon's Spring Sale, there are still hundreds of deals with up to a whopping 54 per cent off this weekend. Shoppers can get popular cleaning equipment from vacuums and window...

item.title: A 'cigarette-addicted' crow is feared dead in East Sussex after six months without a sighting
item.description: A crow that developed a love of cigarettes, stealing Amber Leaf tobacco rollies from a gardener in Bexhill, East Sussex, is feared to have died after six months without a sighting.

item.title: Elon Musk is poised to collect $23bn bonus after Tesla reports record profits
item.description: Musk, the CEO of the American car company, is now set to receive a bonus share payout after the company posted a $3.3 billion quarterly profit on Wednesday.

item.title: Lyrid meteor shower set to dazzle stargazers this weekend with up to 18 meteors an hour
item.description: The celestial display is expected to peak in the early hours of April 23 and will be visible all across the sky.
item.media:description: Lyrid meteor shower set to delight stargazers (Owen Humphreys/PA)

item.title: Shop 25% off in the Boden sale including the best new in pieces you'll wear all season
item.description: Looking to invest in some new season wardrobe pieces? The Boden sale is here and running now through April 25, with 25 per cent off full-priced items.

item.title: Boris Johnson says he wants Indian free trade deal 'done by Diwali' in October
item.description: The news is a boost for the Prime Minister as he seeks to move on from the Partygate scandal engulfing his administration in London.

item.title: The home so filthy it's declared a BIOHAZARD: Cleaner reveals horrifying conditions
item.description: Professional cleaner George Mensah, 58, who runs Merseyside House Clearance, shared clips of the house in Liverpool, swallowed by 20 years of hoarding.

item.title: Garden chair deals: This set of 2 foldable garden chairs are on sale for under £60 on Amazon
item.description: If you're on the hunt for an affordable set of garden chairs to help with your summer entertaining, then the Outsunny Set of 2 Foldable Metal Garden Chairs are now on sale for £59.49.

item.title: Brits mock 'bizarre mash up' of Tom Cruise and Alan Titchmarsh hosting Queen's Jubilee celebration
item.description: Dame Helen Mirren, 76, and Tom Cruise, 59, are set to lead the theatrical production, which will be broadcast live on ITV from the grounds of Windsor Castle on May 15 - alongside Alan Titchmarsh.

item.title: Forget robotic dogs! Scientists develop a robotic RAT that could help in search and rescue missions
item.description: Scientists from the Beijing Institute of Technology have developed a four-legged robotic rat called SQuRo (small-size quadruped robotic rat).

item.title: Meghan Markle's hairdresser reveals how to recreate her signature 'undone luxe' waves
item.description: George Northwood, who has an eponymous salon in London, jetted out to join the Duchess of Sussex in the Netherlands over the weekend. He told British Vogue how he created Meghan's waves.

item.title: Max the pug is caught on camera pummelling his owner's 'hated' cushions [Video]
item.description: Nathan East, 38, walked in on three-year-old pug Max picking a fight with the cream pillow on April 9 at their home in Warwick and was stunned to see him repeatedly jabbing the cream cushion.

item.title: Pictured: The stunning £70million superyacht shaped like a giant knife
item.description: Unique 71 by SkyStyle - which has offices in the USA and Spain - has been designed to penetrate water 'like a blade'. One notable guest feature is a water-level dining area.

item.title: Le Pen accuses Macron of 'not liking the French' and tells him election victory is 'not inevitable'
item.description: Marine le Pen accused the centrist incumbent of 'not liking the French' and failing to appreciate the need for tougher measures to protect low-income households from rising prices in France.

item.title: Bisexual people reveal which gender they prefer to date
item.description: Bisexual people from around the world have taken to anonymous sharing app Whisper to reveal the reason they prefer to date either a man or woman based on their past experiences.

item.title: Hunky British Transport officer goes viral on TikTok
item.description: British Transport Police officer Zak Stevens left TikTok users swooning after a video of him working on a train travelling from Newcastle to King's Cross went viral.

item.title: Bad celebrity courtroom sketches - how many can YOU identify?
item.description: Celebrities like Rihanna, Katy Perry and Catherine Zeta Jones have all had their famously flawless visages butchered by an artist's pen, leaving them looking decidedly ordinary.
item.media:credit: Shutterstock / Mona Shafer Edwards / BACKGRID / MB Media / SplashNews.com

item.title: Drunk mum, 32, punched taxi driver and assaulted two police officers
item.description: Armani Nicholson, 32, hopped in a taxi from Darlington to her home in Middleton St George after celebrating Mother's Day early with friends and family.

item.title: Inside the Posh Pawn shop where celebs pick up second-hand Birkin bags
item.description: James Constantinou, 55, who founded Prestige Pawnbrokers in Weybrudge in 2009 told FEMAIL that his star clients can afford to shop at Harrods but don't want to wait for luxury goods.

item.title: Kate is tipped to replace Prince Andrew as the next Colonel of the Grenadier Guards
item.description: The revelation comes as the Duchess of Cambridge, 40, is lined up to stand in for the Queen at the Sovereign's Parade at the Royal Military Academy Sandhurst.

item.title: Counter terror police say evidence of 'Russian war crimes' is 'beyond comprehension'
item.description: The Metropolitan Police's War Crimes Team, a unit within its counter-terrorism command, said it had already received around 50 referrals from people with a link to the UK.

item.title: Mangled tanks dumped in streets and fields reveal the scale of Russia's military losses
item.description: Drone images have revealed huge graveyards of the charred and mangled military vehicles, with broken guns and howitzers also dumped in the field.

item.title: Fresh violence breaks out at Jerusalem's holy site Al-Aqsa mosque as Israeli police storm complex
item.description: At around 4:00am, Palestinians began hurling stones towards the Western Wall in Jerusalem, considered the holiest site where Jews can pray, the police said after rushing the crowd.
item.media:description: Palestinian demonstrators clash with Israeli police at Jerusalem's Al-Aqsa mosque compound after the morning prayers in east Jerusalem

item.title: Survivor lifts lid on how 1,000 child migrants were sent to notorious Australian orphanage
item.description: Author David Hill (circled above as a child) was among the children who were abused at Fairbridge Farm School in Molong, New South Wales, which operated between 1938 and 1974.

item.title: Google Doodle marks Earth Day 2022 with dramatic time-lapse images of melting glaciers
item.description: Google is marking Earth Day 2022 with a selection of time-lapse satellite images on its homepage, showing the dramatic impacts of climate change on our planet.

item.title: Landowner found guilty of illegally chopping down woodland the size of TWELVE football pitches
item.description: Jeff Lane, 71, was found guilty of illegal felling in the Gower area of Wales - an official are of Outstanding Natural Beauty and the first designated in the UK.

item.title: Western spy agencies warn working from home INCREASES the risk of a Russian cyber attack
item.description: An alert has been issued by agencies from the Five Eyes alliance - made up of Australia, Canada, New Zealand, the UK and US.

item.title: Indiana Jones was right! Smaller species of scorpions ARE more deadly than larger ones
item.description: Researchers from NUI Galway analysed 36 species of scorpions and found that the smallest species were over 100 times more potent that then largest.

item.title: Boris Johnson DEFENDS green taxes on families saying they are helping to CUT bills
item.description: Tory MPs are urging Boris Johnson to scrap the taxes, which add about £160 a year to energy bills, to help households as gas and oil prices reach record levels.

item.title: Will my P&O Cruise be affected by P&O Ferries sackings?
item.description: I've booked a trip with P&O Cruises. Are the companies related and will my holiday be impacted?

item.title: New York From The Air: Photobook takes readers on a 'breathtaking journey' across an iconic skyline
item.description: With over 200 pictures taken from helicopter and rooftop vantages, book New York From The Air takes readers on a 'breathtaking journey' across the iconic skyline.

item.title: The pressure-relieving Ergoflex 5G mattress for back pain sufferers is on sale
item.description: The Ergoflex 5G Mattress is specifically designed as a pressure-relieving sleep surface to help ease aches and pains for your best sleep yet. And today, you can save a huge £364 off a double-sized mattress.

item.title: Shocking things received after shopping online - from a cat inside a sofa to a giant tweezer
item.description: People from around the world have revealed the disappointing items they've received after shopping online, with the most amusing examples shared in a gallery by Diply.

item.title: The British star Chelsea Lazkani, 29, taking over Selling Sunset!
item.description: Chelsea Lazkani, 29, from London, gained her real estate license after moving to the US in 2017 and joined the famous Oppenheim Group last year.

item.title: Woman started debate online about attraction after asking if she should date a toothless man
item.description: The anonymous British woman took to the parenting forum Mumsnet where she revealed she'd been blindsided by her date's gappy smile, which he hid in his online profile.

item.title: Now that's a Broadchurch cliffhanger! Amazing images show jumper leaping from crumbling Dorset rocks
item.description: A bold base-jumper leapt off a Dorset cliff not once but twice. The man peered over the edge before taking the plunge off the 180million-year-old, crumbling cliff face on Dorset's Jurassic Coast.

item.title: Russian gas exec is found hanged and his wife and daughter hacked to death in their Spanish villa
item.description: The bodies of the trio were found on Tuesday, just one day after another Russian multimillionaire, his wife and 13-year-old daughter were found dead in their Moscow apartment.

item.title: WHAT BOOK would London-based husband-and-wife writing team Ellery Lloyd take to a desert island?
item.description: Collette Lyons is currently reading It Ends at Midnight by Harriet Tyce. Paul Vlitos, the other half of Ellery Lloyd would take Dickens to a desert island

item.title: Couple who spent thousands on dream garden demand compensation after new road leaves it underwater
item.description: A Kent couple who spent thousands of pounds on their dream garden are seeking compensation from the council after a new road left it in six inches under water.
